intro: Planchonella thiensis, commonly known as the Tihue or Tihue tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to the island of New Caledonia and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are typically spherical and covered in a thick, waxy coating. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its unique ecological role and ornamental value, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
